content: starfish onesie by wendy f 2025 size 62-64 cm gauge stockinette 16 sts x 23 r 10cm x 10cm needles 5mm materials lana grossa bingo 350g 560m stitches k knit p purl chain edge increase kfb knit front and back decrease krpr knit return pass return skp - slip one knit one pass slipped stitch over knit stitch normal bind off whichever you like elastic bind off as explained in this youtube video composition the back is made up of five diamonds to create a star shape the front is open at the arms and head so that it can be opened to put it on - so for the front we only have diamonds for the legs and then two triangles per arm-chest combo and another triangle for the chest opposite the hood to close the onesie i added some strings/bows on the left and right side of the star pattern note the piece consists of diamonds and triangles that are sewn together the diamonds start with 3 cast ons sharp edge inside and end on 6 stitches soft edge outside to give the star a softer look this is why there s a difference between the outer and inner triangles depending on which end of the diamond they mirror they start with either three or six cast ons if you want a simpler version you could just cast on 3 and also do the row until you bind off 3 for all the diamonds and triangles this would also make the star more pointy diamonds 7 pieces 5 for the back 2 for the front of the legs cast on three stitches from now on every first and last stitch will be the chain edge at the beginning of the row yarn to the front and slip the stitch as if to knit at the end of the row knit into the back row 1 chain edge yarn to the front and slip as if to knit kfb chain edge knit into back row 2 chain edge yarn to the front and slip as if to knit purl until one stitch left chain edge knit into back row 3 chain edge kfb kfb chain edge row 4 chain edge purl until one stitch left chain edge row 5 chain edge kfb knit until two stitches left kfb chain edge row 6 chain edge purl until one stitch left chain edge repeat row 5 & 6 about eight times until you have 44 stitches/ 22 row or until your piece is about 16cm long from first to current row now decrease every second row until only six stitches are left the row between decrease row is a normal knit row with the chain edge decrease row chain edge krpr knit until two stitches left skp chain edge normal row chain edge purl until one stitch left chain edge when only six stitches are left bind off triangles 5 pieces for inner and outer part of the arms 1 piece
